WM.content: [exemplary nature of sun in relation to metaphor] if sun is always metaphorical, it has lustre [Mallarmé], is an artificial construction, always other than itself, emerging from itself (father, eye, seed, fire, egg) > via Du Marsais, the philosophical metaphor light of the spirit is a detour w/in (in sight of) reappropriation, presence, etc. (from Platonic eidos to Hegelian Idea), a trope, a borrowed dwelling (house) > here, light is one metaphor among metaphors, and borrowed dwelling, expropriation, becomes metaphor of metaphor
